sentences.english: Building facades pulsate with millions of lights and glowing neon display.
sentences.chinese: 在千万灯光和霓虹灯的照耀下。

sentences.english: City sights, neon lights, grey skys or blue.
sentences.chinese: 都市景色，霓虹灯光，灰或蓝天。

sentences.english: Only use neons in artistic illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 仅使用霓虹灯艺术插图。

sentences.english: Neon lights gleamed in the deepening mists.
sentences.chinese: 霓虹灯在渐浓的雾霭中隐约闪烁。

sentences.english: The cocky lordly dogs like the neon lamps over the streets.
sentences.chinese: 神气活现的狗犹如满街的霓虹灯。

sentences.english: NEON does not support double-precision operations.
sentences.chinese: 霓虹灯不支持双精度运算。

sentences.english: And the sign flashed out its warning in the words that it was forming.
sentences.chinese: 霓虹灯突然闪烁出警兆，警告的语句渐渐成型。

sentences.english: And it designs and manufactures neon lighting advertisement signboards and lightings of all kinds.
sentences.chinese: 并设计制作各种大小型霓虹灯广告招牌，舞台灯光。

sentences.english: Roadside neon colors, bright and eye-catching.
sentences.chinese: 路边的霓虹灯五彩缤纷，灿烂夺目。

sentences.english: You can see everything better after dusk, when the lunatic neon is switched on.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚当狂乱的霓虹灯打开，你就能看得更清楚了。

sentences.english: The neon lights are no longer flashing; the roulette wheels have spun their last turn.
sentences.chinese: 赌场上的霓虹灯不再闪烁，轮盘赌也已转完最后一轮。

definition: bright and multicolored/of rich variety/(fig.) dazzling/glitzy
early evening when lanterns are first lit
lanterns red, wine green (idiom); feasting and pleasure-seeking/debauched and corrupt environment
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
lit. flowing light and overflowing color/brilliant lights and vibrant colors (idiom)
